alert.note: Alert for Kingfisher (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 26 at 8:24PM CST until February 27 at 1:00AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN KINGFISHER...EASTERN WOODS...ALFALFA...NORTHERN BLAINE...WESTERN GRANT...EASTERN DEWEY...WESTERN GARFIELD AND MAJOR COUNTIES... At 823 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Burlington to 3 miles east of Dacoma to 4 miles west of Fay, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Enid, Alva, Fairview, Cherokee, Helena, Waukomis, Okeene, Canton, Lahoma, Ringwood, Drummond, Carmen, Wakita, Cleo Springs, Longdale, Goltry, Ames, Meno, Jet and Aline. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
